main.name: Vítor Cunha
main.description: I am studying information systems at UFSC and working at E3C Tecnologia
main.bio: I have been working with python and django for almost 2 years, I also have familiarity with java, js, html and css.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

education.description: Here was my first contact with programming. I've learned object-oriented programming in Java, data structures, computer architectures, entrepreneurship, systematic view and so on.

work.title: Backend Developer
work.description: I learned and I'm still learning a lot here. I believe the quality of my code has improved a lot after I started working here, being surrounded by very intelligent people who know how to share their knowledge. I work mainly with backend, but I also have a lot of contact with fronted languages and frameworks. Tech and languages i use here: python, django, go, html / css / less / js, mustachejs, backbone etc.

work.title: Backend Developer
work.description: Here was when I got out of from nothing to something. I learned Python and Django, improved Java skills and build/updated APIs. I also had contact with customer support and acquired a lot of knowledge in logistics and transportation.

work.title: PMO assistant
work.description:
Acting in the PMO (Project Management Office) area. Activities:
Demand planning. Daily and weekly performance monitoring of database and software development teams, monitoring and control of demands and projects. It covers the general part of company processes.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
